events.1803: East India Comapny captured Dehli, Agra and Bharooch.
events.1865: Rudyard Kipling, famous English litterateur and author (Jungle Book, Gunga Din-Nobel 1907), was born in Bombay.
events.1879: Shri Ramana Maharshi (1879-1950), modern Hindu Advaita renaissance saint of Maharshi Research Institute, philosopher and yogi, was born in Tiruchuzhi near Madurai in Tamil Nadu.
events.1887: Kanhaiyalal Maneklal Munshi, leader of India Freedom Movement, Law expert, Educationist, Litterateur and founder of "Bhartiya Vidya Bhavan", was born at Bharuch.
events.1906: The All India Muslim League was founded in Dacca by a group of big landlords which included Aga Khan III, The Nawab of Dacca and Nawab Mohsin-ul-Mulk-Salimullah. They supported the Partition of Bengal and called for seperate Muslim electrorates and other safeguard for Muslims.
events.1929: The first inland Indian air mail left New Delhi this morning for Jodhpur, Hyderabad, and Karachi to connect at Karachi with the air service to London.
events.1935: Lord Reading, former Viceroy and Governor General of India, died at the age of 76 at UK.
events.1941: Gandhiji, at his own request, is relieved of hi-leadership of Congress by Working Committee.
events.1946: Jawaharlal Nehru calls on Gandhiji, who says, "My reason wholly supports my heart".
events.1947: India informs Pakistan and other dominion representatives that it has decided to refer the Kashmir issue to the Security Council under Article 35 of the United Nations Charter.
events.1949: India recognizes People's Republic of China.
events.1953: The Untouchability (Offences) Bill published in the Gazette of India.
events.1971: Vikram Ambalal Sarabhai, famous nuclear scientist, died.
events.1974: Opening of the fifth Indian Film Festival. It was presided over by Satyajit Ray at New Delhi.
events.1993: Government gets majority when 10 members of Ajit faction of the JD merge with the Congress.
